item.title: 8 Konami Games With The Best Stories, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Konami has regained its footing and is serious about game development, offering quality titles once again.
  • Story-driven Konami games like Castlevania: Aria of Sorrow and Suikoden 5 offer engaging plots and memorable experiences.
  • Games like Metal Gear Solid 2 and Silent Hill 2 offer wild and emotional narratives that fans love, enhancing gameplay.

Konami faced a rocky ride in the industry following Hideo Kojima's widely publicized departure, but it seems that the company has finally started regaining its footing. They've become serious about video game development once again, letting players enjoy some quality titles.

Some of the best story-driven Konami games players can get their hands on are quite riveting and let players embark on some amazing journeys. The gameplay keeps players entertained as they move the plot forward and uncover some amazing revelations in the process.

8 Castlevania: Aria Of Sorrow

The Whodunit Storyline Is Pretty Engaging

While Castlevania is largely known as a gameplay-first series, Aria of Sorrow should still be commended for boasting a pretty engaging plot. Every character in the game boasts a compelling personality as players try to figure out which character is masquerading as Dracula.

This keeps players on the edge of their seats as they make progress in Dracula's castle and deal with a whole host of enemies. Aria of Sorrow 's plot twist builds up beautifully as players second-guess every character's true intentions during this glorious adventure.

7 Suikoden 5

The Plot Twist Makes For One Of The Best Suikoden Plotlines

Suikoden 5 is one of the better games in the series that fans can check out if they want to enjoy a great plot. While the second Suikoden game technically spoils the plot twist of this title, chances are that most people won't remember the details relevant to the fifth mainline entry.

As a result, Suikoden 5 's narrative ends up being the strongest part of the experience, as people play as the Prince of Falena and acquire numerous allies in their journey. It's a great look back at the history of Suikoden 's world and leaves players breathless with a plot that can surprise them every step of the way.

6 Policenauts

Kojima's Eccentric Storytelling Shines In This Underrated Visual Novel

Kojima's track record with Konami has led to the creation of some amazing story-driven games, and Policenauts is no exception to this golden rule. The game is full of endearing technicalities and strong writing that shows Kojima's eccentricities and fascination with Western culture.

Players will be drawn into this game's amazing world as they come across a riveting mystery that takes place in the mid-21st century. As long as players don't mind the retro elements of this title, they'll have a great time with Policenauts .

5 Silent Hill 4: The Room

One Of The Most Unique And Bizarre Games In The Series, Which Is Saying Something

The Silent Hill series is known for featuring some wild and riveting plots, but Silent Hill 4 takes the cake. The plot of this game is bizarre in all the best ways and makes for a riveting experience as players control a man stuck in his apartment.

This makes for some memorable gameplay moments as the familiar environments of Silent Hill 4 morph into terrifying structures that will leave a lasting impression on players. In a bid to escape the apartment, Henry Townshend ventures into different dimensions and uncovers some intense plot revelations that will leave fans reeling.

4 Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty

A Wild And Ridiculous Story That MGS Fans Love

From the very moment Metal Gear Solid 2 starts, players are treated to one of the greatest bait-and-switches in gaming history that had a lasting impact on MGS fans. Losing control of the beloved Solid Snake didn't sit right with many, but Raiden eventually wormed his way into the hearts of fans.

It helps that the wild and thought-provoking plot of Metal Gear Solid 2 tackles everything from the evils of technology to what freedom of thought entails. The sheer number of wild swerves in the plot make for a memorable experience that fans of the Metal Gear Solid series still love to this day.

3 Suikoden 2

The Best Game In The Series With The Plot To Match

Suikoden 2 is hailed by many as one of the best entries in the series, and for good reason. Not only is the gameplay perfected from the first game, but the story lets people play a central role in an epic conflict.

The war between the nations of Highland and the City-States of Jowston is something players are thrown smack-dab in the middle of. The plot is further strengthened by the addition of Luca Blight, one of the greatest JRPG antagonists of all time who players love to hate.

2 Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater

The Emotional High Points Of The Game Hit Like A Ton Of Bricks

Metal Gear Solid 3 was a great introduction to the series of many, detailing the adventures of Naked Snake as he finds himself in the middle of a massive conspiracy. What makes this narrative so emotional is the bond he shares with The Boss, one of the most riveting characters in the series.

It's easy to see why Naked Snake feels betrayed by his mentor's actions, only for the truth to come to light after a climactic encounter between the two. It's easy for the tears to start flowing as the plot of Metal Gear Solid 3 throws numerous emotional curveballs at players, getting them invested in one of the best titles in the series.

1 Silent Hill 2

The Mind-Bending Story Makes For A Psychological Horror Masterpiece

Silent Hill 2 is one of the greatest video games ever made, and players love that the remake did justice to the legacy of the original. James Sunderland's quest to find his wife takes numerous dark turns as the town of Silent Hill plays with his mind.

As the psychological horror of this title rears its ugly head, fans slowly uncover the truth behind the game's bizarre events, culminating in one of the most shocking plot twists in gaming history. The incredible story of Silent Hill 2 is a huge reason why fans can't stop raving about this incredible experience.

item.title: Rainbow Six Siege Details Year 10 Season 1 Plans
item.description:
Summary

  • New operator, Rauora, and reputation system debut in Rainbow Six Siege Year 10.
  • Operation Prep Phase introduces Rauora with unique gadgets and rewards based on player ratings.
  • Dynamic matchmaking system 1.0 and measures against exploits and cheating are part of the update.

Ubisoft has officially unveiled Rainbow Six Siege 's Year 10 Season 1, including the debut of the new operator Rauora and the reputation system. Rainbow Six Siege has been getting regular updates since its launch, with some bringing new seasons and features to attract new players and keep veterans engaged.

The most recent Rainbow Six Siege season is Operation Collision Point, which was released in December 2024. The main part of the update is the Blackbeard remaster, giving one of the shooter's veteran operators a complete revamp of his abilities. This same season saw the addition of new cross-play between console and PC, new measures to protect and improve the player experience, and various balances. Now, Ubisoft's shooter is preparing for what's next.

Rainbow Six Siege Year 10 has been officially unveiled, the first season being Operation Prep Phase. The highlight of the update will be the debut of Rauora, a new Rainbow Six Siege attack operator who will be first available via the battle pass, and later, via Renown or R6 Credits. For the first time in the game's history, a character will have a Reaper MK2 pistol as her secondary weapon. Her unique gadget is the Deployable Omnilink Mesh (D.O.M.), a launcher that deploys bulletproof panels on doorways. With them, Rauora can block her opponents' line of sight and obstruct their movement.

Rainbow Six Siege Year 10 Season 1 New Features

  • New attack operator Rauora
  • Reputation system
  • Dynamic matchmaking 1.0 system
  • New measures to reduce exploits and cheating

In addition to Rauora's debut, Ubisoft confirmed the arrival of the reputation system. As a result, players with a Respectable rating and above in Rainbow Six Siege Year 9 Season 4 will receive an Alpha Pack as a reward. On the other hand, players with a Disruptive or Dishonorable rating will be restricted from playlists and unlocking certain rewards. The update will add new mechanisms to reduce exploits and cheating, and a new matchmaking system. From Operation Prep Phase, the devs plan to optimize matchmaking based on the volume of server requests with the inclusion of dynamic matchmaking 1.0, guaranteeing better matches even at peak times.

While players wait for more news about next year's first season, big news is coming. Rainbow Six Siege has announced a showcase for March, at which the devs plan to unveil the new Rainbow Six Siege X game. The game is eagerly awaited, as initial details suggest that it will have greatly improved graphics, paired with new events and features that have yet to be revealed.

item.title: 8 Best Medieval-Style Action Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Medieval-style action games, from Skyrim to The Witcher 3 , offer immersive worlds and varied combat systems.
  • The difficulty and complexity of combat enhances gameplay in games like Dark Souls 3 and Middle-earth: Shadow of War .
  • Medieval and medieval-inspired settings are crucial to each of these games, driving narratives, building realism, and enhancing gameplay.

Since the days of old-school RPGs, medieval-style action games have been a staple of gaming, from the high fantasy combat of The Elder Scrolls: Arena all the way back in 1994 to the beautifully grounded realism of Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . With a major release every several years, this genre isn't falling into obscurity any time soon. Many more years of dragon slaying, justice bringing, and world exploring awaits.

With only a sword on their back and a handful of coins to their name, players must survive in hostile worlds, overcoming the dangers of dastardly dragons, savage brigands, and villainous empires. Players must master their weapons and abilities if they are to stand any hope of carving out a legacy.

The following games are ranked on how engaging their action is — and the extent to which their medieval-style setting enhances gameplay.

Only medieval-style action games featuring real-time combat are included on this list.

8 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Varied But Ultimately Simplistic Combat

  • Open-world high fantasy RPG
  • Diverse combat that has aged poorly
  • Features realistic and fantasy-themed threats

In this iconic open-world high fantasy RPG, players take on the role of a newly escaped prisoner of war. In this game, players explore the beautiful land of Skyrim , locking swords with its many dangers, both fantastical and not. Here, players will make a name for themselves, rising from a penniless prisoner to the legendary savior of Tamriel.

Locked in frantic, fast-paced combat, often against multiple foes, players must quickly learn how to balance their health, stamina, and magicka if they're to survive. There's tons of variety to be found in this game's combat system, including an expansive perk tree where players can unlock an array of powerful bonuses and abilities. Unfortunately, Skyrim's combat system does not hold up long-term. Late-game combat devolves into simple button mashing, with little risk of death for the player.

Skyrim's medieval setting is a vital part of its narrative. Every quest, from the grand to the mundane, revolves around it, whether deities, destiny, and dragons or the more realistic threats of clan feuds, encroaching empires, and conflicting factions.

7 Dragon's Dogma 2

Organic Combat, Weak Medieval Setting

  • Open-world fantasy RPG
  • Incredibly organic combat encounters
  • Limited enemy variety

In this open-world fantasy RPG, players are let loose to explore the beautifully wild lands of Dragon's Dogma 2 . Wrestle treasure hordes from deadly monsters, assemble an unstoppable squad, or fulfill their destiny as the Arisen; the possibilities are endless.

Players looking for a more organic approach to combat are in for a treat here. Combat can erupt at any moment, turning peaceful forest exploration into an epic player vs. griffon battle for survival. Even players expecting danger can never be certain of what to expect. All it takes is an unsuspecting troll to wander into a player's path, and their simple goblin fight transforms into a frantic battle for survival. Once locked into such an encounter, players must navigate an ever-evolving battle as monsters and companions adapt their strategies from one moment to the next. Players must keep up if they're to stand a chance.

Of course, none of these epic battles would be possible without Dragon Dogma 2's medieval fantasy setting. Many locations lean more heavily on their medieval inspiration, rather than the fantastical elements of the world, but the game offers little in the way of enemy variety, which can detract from long-term enjoyment of the open-world experience.

6 Dark Souls 3

Relentless Combat With A Dark Fantasy Twist

  • Dark fantasy RPG
  • Notoriously difficult combat that can be rewarding or frustrating
  • Setting subverts players' expectations

Renowned for its intense difficulty and complex combat mechanics, Dark Souls 3 players take on the role of lone warriors fighting through the lands of a world fallen to decay. Terrifying horrors and otherworldly terrors lurk around every corner, ready to butcher players at a moment's notice. Needless to say, this is not a game for the light-hearted or the impatient.

Players looking to push their skills to the limit will find a lot to love in this series. Pitting players against seemingly unkillable monsters, players are forced to reevaluate everything they've ever learned about combat. There's no overpowered weapon, difficulty lowering, or pausing here — only players, their characters, and their ability to adapt and overcome. For some, this will be the ideal challenge. Those looking for a laidback and relaxing game will, however, want to look elsewhere.

No game quite subverts players' expectations as well as the Dark Souls games when it comes to its setting. Rather than the beautifully whimsical worlds players have come to anticipate from high fantasy, players are instead greeted by a festering world gone to ruin, one where elves and dragons are replaced by gruesome horrors and terrible monstrosities. The setting itself is the most fantastical on this list, but what it lacks in medieval realism it more than makes up for in its gritty action.

5 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Engaging Action With Medieval Fantasy Plots

  • High fantasy party-based RPG
  • Thrilling and complex combat
  • Medieval setting is integral to the game

A fantasy RPG staple for over a decade, most gamers will at least know of Dragon Age: Inquisition . Players are free to explore a sprawling high fantasy world, assembling a rag-tag faction hell-bent on thwarting the chaotic forces that seek to bring the world to ruin.

Combat is a visually engaging and mechanically rich endeavor that presents players with an array of abilities and attacks with which to obliterate their enemies. Built around the classic selection of mage, warrior, and rogue, each class boasts three unique subclasses filled to the brim with deadly attacks and powerful abilities that are sure to change the tide of any battle. The only problem is deciding which skill to pick first! Combat can also strike at any moment, as it's inherently tied to the game's narrative. All it takes is one poor decision and a tense negotiation descends into a deadly brawl.

Inquisition's medieval setting is at the heart of the series. Every game is driven by medieval high fantasy elements, usually that of the misuse of magic and its world-shattering effects. The same can be said of most side quests, which feature magic, mythical monsters, and gods galore. Others, meanwhile, revolve around more realistic medieval themes, including those of poverty, famine, and class division.

4 Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War

Satisfying Combat, Varied Approach

  • Open-world RPG set in Middle-earth
  • Satisfying, well-refined, and varied combat
  • Expansive skill tree

Join forces with Talion, a wraith-bound human, in his quest to save Tolkien's Middle-earth from evil. With the power of a wraith on his side, Talion has an array of superhuman powers with which to thwart the orc-infested lands of Mordor and beyond.

By far the best aspect of this game is its combat, which is responsive, satisfying, and oh-so-varied. Whether facing off against orc grunts, hulking generals, or rampaging monsters, no one battle ever feels the same, as players always have new surroundings, threats, and environmental hazards to contend with. Combat is incredibly engaging, rewarding well-timed attacks with brutal combos and epic killing animations.

For all the superhuman powers this game gives players, it sure can be punishing! Overconfidence is a swift killer, especially on harder difficulties. Death is penalized by advancing time, meaning a general that players were looking to capture might be dead by the time the player respawns. Shadow Of War also features a complex skill tree for players to sink their teeth into. With the right skills unlocked, players can even ride drakes into battle!

3 The Witcher 3

Endless Variety, Brutal Setting

  • Slavic mythos-inspired dark fantasy RPG
  • Incredibly diverse combat
  • Gritty realistic medieval setting

Join Geralt of Rivia as he journeys across the Slavic mythos-inspired lands of The Witcher 3 . Chaos and destruction run rampant in this dark fantasy world, either by the blades of violent humans, elves, and dwarves, or the fangs of monstrous beasts. No place is safe here, least of all for Geralt, a despised mutant known as a Witcher.

T he Witcher 3's combat mechanics offer players unparalleled variety to fights. Whether it's combat skills, powerful signs, potions and tonics, or weapon coatings, thes game provides near-endless ways for players to customize their combat experience. Those looking to take a tougher, if not reckless, approach can go in blind, facing off against powerful foes at a severe disadvantage. Players willing to spend a little extra time, meanwhile, can study and learn about their prey, crafting potions and bringing along deadly weapon coatings to transform themselves into a monster mashing machine. Whatever the strategy, players must be ready to adapt at a moment's notice, as the tide of combat is forever changing.

The Witcher's medieval setting is essential to the series, providing an excellent backdrop against which to illustrate the true horror and violence of this world. Much like in the real world, war, plagues, prejudice, and famine run rampant here, striking down the kind and the barbaric without prejudice. It is not a fair world, but rather a realistic one, despite its numerous fantastical elements.

2 Mount & Blade 2: Bannerlord

Battle Altering Power, Expansive Medieval World

  • Open-world strategy RPG
  • Players participate actively in battles
  • Carve out a destiny in a realistic medieval world

Set in a realistic medieval world, this open-world RPG places players firmly in the driving seat of their own destiny. Starting out as a new adventurer, players are free to explore, fight, or negotiate their way through the world, making friends and enemies how, where, or whenever they like. There's no set goal here, only those the players give themselves.

The Mount & Blade series showcases some of the best combat seen in the medieval action genre. With only a weapon on their back and faithful steed beneath them, players can single-handedly change the course of even the most futile of battles. Combat is intensely brutal as players fight on the ground against hordes of enemy soldiers. Helping them in this quest is an array of weapons, armor, and equipment for players to choose from, each with their own advantages and drawbacks.

Mount & Blade 2's medieval setting is the backbone of the series. Its gameplay revolves around players carving out a name for themselves, whether as a mercenary, raider, or the ruler of a nation, something that is directly instigated by its medieval world — that being one of hardship, where those who fail to obtain glory fade into obscurity.

1 Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

Realistic Combat, Brutal Warfare

  • Realistic medieval open-world RPG
  • Combat requires precision and strategy
  • Plot directly explores the horrors of medieval warfare

In this realistic open-world RPG, players follow Henry's story as he sets out on a quest to avenge his murdered family. This is not a world of nonchalant battles and glory-seeking but one of gritty violence and daily struggles for survival.

Button-mashing attacks will get players nowhere here. Instead, precision, timing, and restraint are the name of the game, with combat being more a test of strategy than it is of strength. Akin to reality, fighting multiple enemies is all but a death sentence for new players. Even for the war-hardened, these battles should not be entered into lightly, no matter how powerful Henry becomes.

Medieval warfare is this game's bread and butter, with a central plot that seeks to shed light on the truly horrifying reality of war. There is no fantasy in which the player or Henry can hide from this reality — no magical way to revive the dead and prevent catastrophes, nor an unquestionably evil enemy to unite against. It’s just people murdering other people, perpetuating a cycle of vengeance and violence.

item.title: Warriors: Abyss - 8 Best Heroes To Unlock ASAP
item.description:
Summary

  • Players start with a dozen heroes in Warriors: Abyss, but the Hall of Bonded Souls allows them to unlock many more.
  • Players can unlock powerful and fun-to-use characters like Hanbei Takenaka, Huang Zhong, and Kotaro Fuma to enhance their gameplay experience and stats.
  • Characters like Masamune Date, Naotora Li, and Tadakatsu Honda offer unique abilities and upgrades that impact gameplay effectiveness.

At this point, it's expected that there will be a permanent upgrade system in a roguelike as opposed to the old style, which was more arcade-like in nature. Warriors: Abyss , a spin-off to both Dynasty Warriors and Samurai Warriors , does indeed have a good upgrade system, referred to as the Hall of Bonded Souls.

Players will start Warriors: Abyss with over a dozen heroes to choose from, but the Hall of Bonded Souls can unlock more. There are about a hundred in total, and future updates from Koei Tecmo/Omega Force may add more. Unlocking heroes comes with the bonus of upgrading stats, including Attack Power, Defense, and Health. So, of the many heroes in the Hall of Bonded Souls, these are the ones that are both beneficial and fun to use once unlocked.

8 Hanbei Takenaka

Young But Still Capable

  • Upgrade Effect: +3 Defense

Hanbei Takenaka is one of the younger characters in Warriors: Abyss , and he also has a strange weapon. His shield is a yo-yo that he can fling at enemies as if it were a natural extension of his body. Players should find it easy to string combos together with this weapon, and Hanbei is an overall agile character.

Taking his stats into consideration, he’s about middle of the pack without excelling in anything in particular, but that’s not a bad thing. His boost to the player's overall skill tree is good for Defense, too.

7 Huang Zhong

This Old Man Can Still Crank That Bow

  • Upgrade Effect: +4 Health

Huang Zhong looks like he should have retired from being an action hero, but this old codger still has some fight in him. He’s one of the few bow users in Warriors: Abyss who actually uses the weapon properly for most of his combos. As an opposing example, one of the starting bow characters, Ina, uses her weapon more like a sword.

Huang can pull back and fire many arrows to hold enemies back. The wrinkles are deceiving, but Huang is worth unlocking for sure, and he grants a good boost to Health, too.

6 Kotaro Fuma

A Stretchy Demon Ninja

  • Upgrade Effect: +2 Defense

Kotaro Fuma is one of the deadly ninjas that players can summon from the shadows. He looks like a demon and behaves like one, too, as he can unnaturally elongate his arms, evoking imagery of stretchy-limbed characters like Mr. Fantastic.

It doesn’t make a lot of sense, but these Musou games have never been about logic anyway. His sickest move has to be Kotaro’s Musou attack, which sees him spinning like a top, with players being able to direct him around for a limited time. He will boost Defense, too, but that’s not as cool as actually playing Kotaro.

5 Masamune Date

Even With One Eye, He’s Still A Crack Shot

  • Upgrade Effect: +1 Attack

Masamune Date is a samurai who seems like he should have a disadvantage with an eyepatch. However, he still manages to hit his targets with deadly accuracy. His main weapon is a katana, but his combos, along with his Musou attack, see him bringing out pistols, as if to emulate a gun-toting action hero akin to Dante from Devil May Cry .

Right next to Masamune on the upgrade tree is Magoichi Saika, a character who wields a musket. They both boost Attack power and are fun to use, but Masamune is a bit more versatile.

4 Naotora Li

These Fists Launch Tornadoes

  • Upgrade Effect: +1 Attack

Naotora Li looks like a bit of a ditzy fighter because of the way her character is positioned, and her speech pattern is timid. However, like Huang’s old age, Naotora has a deadly secret. This beauty can punch so hard that she can create tornadoes on the battlefield.

Her punches and kicks are legendary, making her both an agile and a strong warrior to choose. She’d give a warrior monk like Tifa from Final Fantasy 7 a run for her money and then some.

3 Sun Quan

Tokyo Drifting Through The Underworld

  • Upgrade Effect: +4 Health

Sun Quan, like many characters in Warriors: Abyss , uses a sword. However, he holds it behind his back and drags it on the ground to create a dazzling effect. If players can string the right moves together, Sun will zip behind an enemy and then surprise them with a flaming blade.

This fire effect will then continue to burn for a few seconds on his sword. Sun is one of the only characters who can use elemental coatings like this naturally without the aid of temporary upgrades like Emblems, making him a rare commodity.

2 Tadakatsu Honda

An Unbreakable Wall

  • Upgrade Effect: +10 Defense

Tadakatsu Honda is an example of a Warriors: Abyss character who players should unlock as fast as possible , but he is not fun to use. Tadakatsu is plenty strong with his attacks, and he can retain a lot of damage. His slowness is not appealing, though, and his combos are kind of basic.

Still, his boost to Defense is too good to pass up. Boosting Defense, even more than Health, will help Warriors: Abyss players survive longer, and survival is always a key factor in a roguelike.

1 Yoshitsugu Otani

A True Mage Of The Samurai Age

  • Upgrade Effect: +3 Defense

There are characters like Sun Quan who have a light command of the elements. Then there are mage-like characters akin to Yoshitsugu Otani in Warriors: Abyss , who can control straight-up magic.

With his frilly baton, this wizard can create bolts of lightning, balls of energy, tornadoes, lasers, and so much more with just a few simple flicks. He is weaker against bosses, though, so he is definitely more of a crowd-dispersing character, but that’s still pretty intense.

item.title: Helldivers 2: Best Predator Strain Loadouts
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Predator Strain Loadout #1: Double Sentries
  • Predator Strain Loadout #2: Maximum Stagger and Shred

The Predator Strain is a terrifying Terminid subfaction in Helldivers 2 , mutated by the mysterious spore cloud known as the Gloom. These enhanced creatures are faster, stronger, smarter, and deadlier than their normal counterparts. Currently, only two Predator Strains have been revealed: the Predator Stalkers and the Predator Hunters, with possibly more hiding deep within the Gloom.

Facing these new Terminid enemies requires more than just a good weapon and a stratagem that creates flashy explosions. You need a well-planned loadout that balances firepower, utility, and survival. To that end, here are the most optimal loadouts and builds recommended for the Predator Strain in Helldivers 2 , ensuring you have the weapons, stratagems, and gear needed to put them down with ease.

Predator Strain Loadout #1: Double Sentries

Primary

SG-8 Punisher / SG-451 Cookout

Secondary

GP-31 Grenade Pistol

Grenade

G-13 Incendiary Impact

Armor Passive

Med-Kit

Stratagems

  • EAT-17 Expendable Anti-Tank
  • AX/TX-13 "Guard Dog" Dog Breath
  • A/G-16 Gatling Sentry
  • A/MG-43 Machine Gun Sentry

The SG-8 Punisher and SG-451 Cookout are the best answers to the Gloom-enhanced strain of Terminid Predators. Both shotguns stagger enemies on hit, stopping them in their tracks, and giving you enough time to unload more pellets into their mutated carapaces. The Punisher does more damage, but the Cookout fires incendiary pellets to set enemies ablaze, allowing you to retreat or focus on other targets while leaving them to burn.

The footage below shows how powerful stagger shots can be in Helldivers 2 . Notice how the Cookout momentarily stuns Predator Stalkers with each shot, and completely obliterates Predator Hunters with a single blast.

Bringing both the A/G-16 Gatling Sentry and the A/MG-43 Machine Gun Sentry provides a critical tactical edge against the Predator Strain in Helldivers 2 , especially since they hunt in relentless packs. However, do not deploy both at once. Instead, drop one, then call in the other when the first has done its job. This rotation keeps a sentry active at all times , ensuring a continuous stream of firepower to cut down bugs in every engagement.

The EAT-17 Expendable Anti-Tank takes care of all heavies. It also provides the distinct advantage of picking up another support weapon you may find at a point of interest, leaving you free to call in an EAT-17 during an encounter and switch weapons as needed.

The AX/TX-13 "Guard Dog" Dog Breath may not be the most popular choice, but it is a perfect fit for a Predator Strain loadout in Helldivers 2 . This automated backpack blinds and slows enemies that get too close. With Predator Stalkers and Hunters able to quickly reach your location by the dozens, the Dog Breath ensures your flank stays covered at all times.

Predator Strain Loadout #2: Maximum Stagger and Shred

Primary

SG-8 Punisher

Secondary

GP-31 Grenade Pistol

Grenade

G-123 Thermite

Armor Passive

Siege-Ready

Stratagems

  • M-105 Stalwart / MG-43 Machine Gun (Support)
  • AX/LAS-5 "Guard Dog" Rover / SH-32 Shield Generator Pack
  • Orbital Railcannon Strike / Eagle 500kg Bomb
  • Orbital Laser

The best Predator Strain loadout in Helldivers 2 is all about mowing down Terminid swarms while keeping them at bay. The SG-8 Punisher offers devastating close-medium-range stopping power to quickly neutralize any advancing Predator Stalkers.

Your main firepower, however, will come from the hail of bullets from either the M-105 Stalwart or MG-43 Machine Gun . Both are top-tier support weapons in Helldivers 2 , featuring high fire rates, large magazine capacities and stagger on every hit , making them perfect for cutting through waves of Predator Terminids.

Add the Siege-Ready armor passive to this loadout, and your weapons get increased reload speed and ammo capacity, meaning your relentless barrage of fire will be even longer . When the magazine dries out, switch to the Punisher to blast any remaining enemies. Pair Siege-Ready with heavy armor, and you will be an unstoppable juggernaut, holding the line against even the most overwhelming swarms.

The G-123 Thermite Grenade and Orbital Railcannon Strike should be enough to take out any Bile Titans and Impalers in Helldivers 2 .

As for the AX/LAS-5 "Guard Dog" Rover , it automatically watches your flank and fries any wandering light enemies. You can switch it with the SH-32 Shield Generator Pack to improve your defenses or choose any other stratagem to add more utility.
